In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can solve this problem in Julia using the `lowercase`, `strip` functions from base Julia. Here is a simple implementation:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col))," ","_")
end
```
This function works as follows: 
- `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespaces from the column name.
- `lowercase(strip(col))` converts all characters to lower case.
- `replace(lowercase(strip(col))," ","_")` replaces spaces with underscores in the cleaned string.
